timeline.message:
Add session property for targetResultSize

Setting the `target_result_size` session property will add the specified
`targetResultSize` as a parameter to the nextUri in a statement.

timeline.bodyText: how about getTargetResultSize(session).ifPresent( targetResultSize ->  uri.queryParam("targetResultSize", targetResultSize)) ?
timeline.author: cemcayiroglu

replies.bodyText: It's a small point, but I didn't want the detail of whether or not the builder returns a copy to change the behavior.
replies.author: tdcmeehan

timeline.bodyText: How this param is going to be used?
timeline.author: highker

replies.bodyText:
It's used here: https://github.com/prestodb/presto/blob/master/presto-main/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/server/protocol/ExecutingStatementResource.java#L152
This will change the batch size to be streamed back from the coordinator to the client.
This change could have been made differently.  We could have chosen to not add this as a query parameter, and instead use it directly inside the coordinator (without parsing it from the URI).  The intent is to set a default from the coordinator to be sent back to the client.  Because there's already a query parameter for this in ExecutingStatementResource, it seemed natural to simply add it to the nextUri.
replies.author: tdcmeehan
